intro: Clematis oweniae, commonly known as the Kauai clematis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Kauai. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces blue or violet flowers with yellow stamens, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in native forest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
